text: Preheat the oven to 170ºC. Cover the baking tray (sheet) with baking (parchment) paper. Dissolve the saffron in the boiling water.  Beat the butter, sugar and saffron water until smooth. Add the egg yolk. Sift the flour, baking powder and spices together. Add them to the batter. Mix well. Sprinkle flour over a work surface. Add the biscuit dough to the surface of the work area. Roll out the dough quickly and cut rounds. If it's the holiday season, you could also try stars or other shapes if preferred. Assemble the cut biscuits onto the covered baking tray (sheet). Sprinkle sugar over the top of each biscuit and add a small strand or two of saffron. Place the biscuits into the preheated oven. Cook for 12 minutes or until cooked but not golden in color. Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack. Leave them until cold, then they're ready for serving.
